pros: Benefits, pto package, conditions, student body
cons: None, great place to work

pros: New college leadership, college is in transition after years of enrollment declines
cons: Enrollment is still declining, too early to tell if changes will stabilize the college's financial picture

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros: Kind and competent supervisor Flexible hours
cons: Low pay, no rewards, no tips

pros: Most of your fellow faculty members are on your side, the rest generally act that way.
cons: Long standing grudges (real or imagined) fuel a good portion of the political environment of the college.

review_title: Decent first job out of college
pros:
- Tuition assistance
- Some paid time off
- Flexible hours
- Little micromanagement
- Excellent learning opportunity for those stepping foot into education administration.
cons:
- Difficult to advance professionally
- Too many structural changes
- Inconsistent leadership
- Poor communication between departments
- Lack of transparency

pros: work environment , supervision,none micro management
cons: HR hiring process. takes too long to hire

pros: Great group to work with, location is beautiful, despite Covid 19, campus has pulling through and staying positive.
cons: Shift from 2 to 4 year schools are impacting college negatively. Budget's are more strict due to Covid.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros: The faculty and students are great. The facilities are up to date.
cons: The enrollment is declining because the administration misspent funds.

pros: Flexible schedule and opportunity to grow
cons: Sometimes things can take a long tome to happen

review_title: I worked in the Admissions Office
pros: Great place to work at because it's a) right on campus b) you can earn some money while your not in class and c) because they work around your class schedule and they make sure you have plenty of time to study and do your homework and they do check your grades at the end of every semester
cons: None that I can think of at this very moment! Plus the good weighs out the bad! There is no downside to working at Dutchess!

pros: Good junior college. Salaries are fairly good for area.  Benefits, also. Two unions cover both staff and some administrators.  Pretty campus.
cons: Top heavy and male-dominated environment.  President can be a micro-manager, not allowing middle management freedome to innovate and grow.  Can be quite resistant to change. Too much civil service mentality, which has grown during current administration.

pros: I earned credits toward my degree through the training course to become a Writing Center peer tutor. The college paid for annual trips to Northeast Writing Center Association conferences.
cons: The size of the Writing Center and the number of students employed made even 10 hours per week a relatively large amount. Pay started out at 7.75 and increased by a quarter a semester, making for small paychecks.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros: The students are diverse and mostly motivated. Many colleagues are caring professionals. The new president is a great improvement over the last one.
cons: Full-time openings are given to committee cronies whether or not they are qualified. There is no opportunity for part time instructors to advance.

review_title: Good institute, but worked under a terrible director.
pros: Nice work environment with use of college facilities. Paid a Decent salary and good benefits. New president making positive change.
cons: The Director lacked management and communication skills. There was little opportunity to chance or improve processes. HR department not easy to deal with.

pros: Flexible hours tutoring, on the job training; tutoring at Dutchess is an excellent opportunity. I would recommend working in the Dutchess tutoring department to current students.
cons: None that I can think of. The school is an excellent place to work and there is nothing to complain about.

job_title: Senior Executive Secretary in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros:
Very good NYS benefits that include health, dental, vision, retirement 
If in the union then job security, for the most part
cons: Culture at College is terrible (it was back then.) No concern for work/life balance, some higher ups have sketchy ethics

pros: So many people to speak with, and meet. This job was truly a very fun job.
cons: Some cons maybe be that there were not many hours available, and you only got paid minimum wage.

pros: Excellent, caring and professional staff
cons: Not enough opportunities to collaborate with colleagues

pros: No long hours.  Provides options for Spanish speaking teachers and students.
cons: Full-time hours limited to 25/week. No benefits.

job_title: Office Assistant in Hyde Park, NY
pros: Good college and good choices for course work
cons: Not so good management tactics

pros: I have a passion for learning
cons: I get discombobulated when there is disorganization.

pros: Coworkers and students - great campus community
cons: College is facing financial challenges presently

job_title: Team Member in New York, NY
pros: The compensation was decent for what was contracted for.
cons: Ethnic exclusion in positions of power

pros: The only upside is teaching and working with students.
